availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elizabeth Evelyn Cartwright O'Hara (Caldwell County, Kentucky, resident and housewife)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, housewife. Caldwell County, Kentucky, native. Daughter of James A. Cartwright and Adeline Graves Cartwright. Married to William O'Hara in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on June 18, 1849. Mother of Irene R. O'Hara, James O'Hara, Paul O'Hara, Gracey O'Hara, Lucian O'Hara, Milton O'Hara, Lizzie O'Hara, and Cora O'Hara. Resident in Caldwell County in 1850. Housewife in Caldwell County in 1860. Household owned nineteen enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
